definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: One day, it might become a forum for settling disputes.
sentences.chinese: 有朝一日它可能会成为解决争端的论坛。

sentences.english: I'll get upsides with him some day.
sentences.chinese: 有朝一日，我总要和他把账算得互不相欠。

sentences.english: We hope to break the foreign [dominance of supply] some day.
sentences.chinese: 希望有朝一日打破外国在供应上的主导地位。

sentences.english: Elsa yearns for the day she can return to her native country.
sentences.chinese: 埃尔莎渴望有朝一日能回到自己的祖国。

sentences.english: Clothes could one day take snaps of everything happening around whoever is wearing them.
sentences.chinese: 有朝一日，衣服可以拍下穿者周围所发生的一切。

sentences.english: I put my ass on the line for you. I know you'll do the same for me someday.
sentences.chinese: 我为你两肋插刀，我知道有朝一日你也会为我这么做。

sentences.english: A:I think maybe one day you can take part in the walking race.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得你有朝一日可以参加竞走比赛。

sentences.english: Thus one day you come to China, I hope I can speak English well enought to be your guide.
sentences.chinese: 我希望有朝一日，你来中国时，我能给你做向导。

sentences.english: All my childhood I dreamt about mountains and hoped to visit Nepal one day.
sentences.chinese: 有朝一日能亲自来尼泊尔摄影，这是我从小的梦想。

sentences.english: I never expected that one of my stories might one day find its way between its pages.
sentences.chinese: 真没想到有朝一日我的故事也能在上面占上一角。

sentences.english: Someday isn’t better than today, often that someday is never.
sentences.chinese: “有朝一日”并不比今天好，通常那一日永远不会来。

sentences.english: The old man made mats by weaving bamboo slats together into a jigsaw-like pattern.
sentences.chinese: 有人听到他侄儿说有朝一日要把那老人干掉。

sentences.english: They all look pale and sick, hoping one day to regain their strength.
sentences.chinese: 他们面色苍白，希望有朝一日能重聚力量。

sentences.english: I think maybe one day you can take part in the walking race.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得你有朝一日可以参加竞走比赛。

sentences.english: I'll come back with honors someday.
sentences.chinese: 有朝一日，我会衣锦还乡。

sentences.english: Jenney dreams of the day when she will be playing the piano for a living.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮梦想着有朝一日能以演奏钢琴为生。

definition: to stand out among one's peers (idiom)/to excel
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
splendor shines on the family's door (idiom)/fig. to bring honor to one's family
an extravagant hope/to have excessive expectations
